Key Match Events: Pakistan won by 5 wickets with 11 balls remaining.
Shaheen Afridi took 4 wickets for 22 runs.
Najmul Hossain Shanto scored 54 runs for Bangladesh.
Mohammad Haris hit a six off a free hit in a high-pressure moment.
Litton Das was run out by a direct hit from Litton Das.
Shakib Al Hasan was controversially given out lbw, which was upheld on DRS.
Pre-Game Insights: News of South Africa's loss to the Netherlands gave Pakistan a chance to qualify for the semi-finals.
Bangladesh won the toss and chose to bat first.
Both teams were aware that the winner would advance to the semi-finals.
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan's captain Babar Azam was praised for his leadership and strategic decisions during the match.
Shaheen Afridi's performance was compared to Wasim Akram's iconic bowling in 1992.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on the same pitch used in the South Africa vs Netherlands game earlier.
The pitch conditions made shot-making difficult throughout the day.
